name: Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we would usually try to go for something a little more boutique and less businessy, actually this hotel turned out to be fab for a holiday base in Sydney. It's big, brash and very business like, but it's location makes it perfect for holiday makers too. It was about 3 days before we ventured more than a walk away from the hotel, there was so much to do right on the door step. We ended up staying here 3 times over our trip to Australia and we'd only really planned on staying there the once.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid for a room with a view for the first visit which was worth it, but downgraded ourselves for the next 2 stays. Honestly the room standard was exactly the same so unless you really want a view I'd go for the regular room and save yourself a few dollars. The beds were comfy, the aircon worked well and quietly (no opening of windows though), bathroom was great. I really have no complaints at all. They started work on the pool on the day we left but noise was minimum and they have an arrangement with another hotel if you wanted to use the pool. I had a facial in their spa while I was there and it was very, very good.
reviews.title: Fabulous location!

likes.disliked: — Hard to get assistance from concierge, elevator service slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was OK and served til 10.30 which is great (sometimes business hotels finish breakfast early). The only gripe I had was the rock ballads CDs they played at top volume - really not breakfast material (and that is really me being very picky).
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's not loads of atmosphere here - but you get that from the city itself so who cares.
reviews.title: Very business oriented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriott as our last stop on a month-long stay in Australia in March 2007. I highly recommend staying at the Marriott:
reviews.title: Central hotel; stands up to the Marriott reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in December 2006. The location is absolutely PERFECT!! It is within easy walking distance of all of the sites in Circular Quay - including the Opera House and the Harbour. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms appeared to have been recently redone. They were very clean with attractive furnishings and wonderful bedding. The cleaning staff are very conscientious - important to us.
reviews.title: Great Location. Very Clean and Comfortable Facilities.

likes.liked: — Location and Cleanliness - it is a NON-smoking hotel.
likes.disliked: — Computer Access - expensive and didn't work properly

reviews.text: One negative: The computers available for guests to use for checking email did not work very well and were very expensive. At a hotel of this calibre I expected internet access to be complimentary.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.text: We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Australia.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

likes.disliked: — No views as other buildings block it

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott as part of our honeymoon to Australia. Emailed the concierge before our arrival to ask about transportation to hotel...we had a lot of bags. He arranged a car service to pick us up at the airport. Very courteous driver, clean Mercedes, carried my wifes bags. Concierge during the day was amazing (wish I could remember his name) but we asked him AT LEAST 2 questions a day. He was knowledgable, always had a smile on his face, and was just great to deal with.
reviews.title: Perfect for Honeymooners!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located within 5 min walk of circular quay port and station. You literally have all forms of transportation within steps...ferry, taxi, bus and train.
reviews.title: First-rate experience

reviews.text: We spent a weekend at the Marriott Circular Quay and absolutely loved it! Upon entering the hotel we had help with our luggage and were able to check in at 10 AM in the morning.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Service, and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room had very nice furniture and a great view of the Sydney Opera House. The bathroom was beautiful and included a tub AND a separate shower.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.liked: — Location and the value for money

reviews.text: We are Marriott Gold members so we also had access to the Concierge Lounge. The lounge was great. Free breakfast in the morning and drinks and appetizers from 4 PM to 9 PM. The lounge was large and nicely stocked.
reviews.title: Great hotel, best location in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is excellent. Within a block of the train station and ferries. (We took the train from the airport to the hotel)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — Maybe the rooms esp. bathrooms need updating

reviews.text: You can see our full trip report with numerous pictures of Sydney at our sunnytripreports web site.
reviews.title: Super location

reviews.text: My family just returned from a lovely stay at the Harbor Marriott. The property was clean, beautiful, and could not be in a better location for shopping in the Rocks district, catching the ferry, or strolling to the Opera House. We will always be grateful to the concierge who steered us to one of the finest meals ever at Aria. Not a place just to go for the view of all Sydney Harbor at your feet - the food was truly fabulous.
reviews.title: All you could want in Sydney

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for 2 days and 2 nights on our way from the US to Melbourne. Upon the advise of other trip advisor reviews, we booked an additional night so that our room would be ready when we arrived at 8 AM. After 14 hours on a plane, being able to check in was wonderful.
reviews.title: Excellent location

likes.disliked: — ask for a room with a view

reviews.title: Perfect location...
reviews.text: There was some initial confusion upon check in with the extra roll-away bed that we requested, but it was all solved very quickly and off we went to our room. The views from our room were excellent. You could see the Opera House right from our window.
We did not eat in the hotel as we found the prices too high - especially with all the other restaurants right in the area.
reviews.title: Only book this hotel if you can't find anything else.!!!

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is the best. The Sydney Explorer tour bus starts right around the corner from the hotel (at Circular Quay) and the Rocks, the Opera House, and all the ferries are right within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Sydney, Perfect Location

reviews.text: Our family just spent 3 nights at this beautiful hotel in Sydney. We paid $50 extra a night and had a stunning view of the Opera House. The room was very nice with 2 queen beds, and a beautiful bathroom. It is not a huge room, but was big enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers and lots of luggage! We requested a newspaper each day and all other requests were promptly met. The hotel is in a great location. We walked to The Rocks area and to the Harbour ferries easily. All of the busses and public transportation are just a block away. There is a nice little Deli just next to the hotel where we ate a few meals...very nice food. The hotel restaurants were very pricey and we never ate at the hotel. The room came with a hot pot and makings for coffee and tea. I would definitely stay there again...it is a great location and we didn't need a car.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: When they say Marriott at Circular Quay they mean right on top of it! You are 1-2 minutes from the Circular Quay hub to catch busses, ferries and trains. Loved the location. The Rocks (with all the pubs and restaurants), Opera house and Pitt street shopping are only a 3-4 miniutes walk. Royal Botanical Gardens 4-5 minute walk. Loved the Flying Foxes by the way.
reviews.title: Loved Marriott at Circular Quay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly. They let us check in early (thank you)and have a late departure. Directions and suggestions seemed second nature to the staff. Wonderful room with the super comfy Marriott beds. Little extra touches made it very special.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Marriott

reviews.text: The only problem was that the elevators were being renovated. But by the second day they had a staff member take you to the service elevators if the delays were too long. I'm sure they will be complete soon.
reviews.title: Great business Traveller Hotel

reviews.text: We were there last month at the start and end of our honeymoon and really enjoyed staying here. The staff knew it was our honeymoon and bumped us to an Executive Level Suite - it was a nice size, 2 bathrooms and a fabulous view of the Opera House. Also, they sent a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine. It was very clean, service was great - concierge was very helful with directions, making dinner reservations, etc - and it is a great location for tourists. Easy access to Opera House, Botanic Gardens, bridge walk, buses, ferries to beaches. There did not seem to be a ton of nightlife and some other areas looked funkier with more interesting shops, bars, maybe cheaper dining options. But it was great if you only have a few days in town and want to hit the big attractions. The Executive Lounge was nice - not sure its worth it if you pay for it (which we did during our end stay) but there is a nice buffet breakfast, soft beferages all day, and a pretty good cocktail hour (2 hrs food, 4 hours drinks). Overall, we highly recommend it for a business stay or a first-timer to Sydney.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for pleasure using Marriott Reward points for 2 nights. The hotel is ideally situated in the Circular Quay area, only 3 minutes from the City Train stop from the airport. Circular Quay is also where the Opera House and the Ferries are located allowing easy access to all of Syndney, including the Rocks area, Harbor Bridge, shopping, Rocks market, and ferries to Manly and everywhere else. The hotel was also within easy walking distance of a number of restaurants in the Rocks area.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: The room provided was better than average for Marriott, with all amenities and nice shower.
reviews.title: Loved everything about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our itinerary for 3 adults was 2 nights in a deluxe room using Marriott points. Then switch to 3 nights in adjoining executive rooms that we paid for. The deluxe room was adequate, although a little crowded for 3 people. Our executive rooms were not ready on time on the day we were supposed to transfer from the deluxe room, so the front desk gave us an upgrade to the Marriott suite on the top floor as an apology. Wow....the view from the living room was spectacular of the harbor and Opera House. It was like staying in a luxurious 2 level townhouse. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever experienced. Excellent food, snacks and spirits in the executive lounge which also had an magnificient view of the harbor. Hotel location is great, we wallked to Circular Quay, the Rocks, the Bridge Climb and local shopping. Gift shop in the hotel had very nice items but a little pricey. Hotel staff including front desk, concierge, bell hop, etc were very pleasant and attentive to all our requests. Great lobby for people watching. All in all a very favorable impression and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Good location. Average hotel.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a week and a half. We found the hotel's location excellent because of it's location at the Circular Quay and proximity to the Sydney Opera House. The room itself was pretty standard - nothing special except a view of the Opera House.
reviews.title: Loved it.. perfect location

likes.disliked: — The breakfast at the Club Lounge..

reviews.text: One of the most frustrating parts of our stay was the slow elevators. Though they have multiple lifts, they don't communicate with each other and make for long waits. On Sunday mornings it was not unusual to wait 30 - 40 minutes for an already overstuffed elevator. We stayed on the 22nd floor and at times felt like taking the stairs, but the stairwells were locked with alarmed (fire exit only) doors. We felt imprisoned.
reviews.title: Second stay - just as fantastic!
Fantastic!
reviews.text: If you are planning to experience Sydney,Australia the place to stay is Sydney Harbour Marriott, you will find it a great location to connect anywhere and about a 3 min walk to the harbor and circular quay. Great views of the harbour bridge and opera house, good shopping down pitt street and the harbor (all walking distance).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upgrade to executive level and enjoy great company with nice breakfast and evening drinks and snaks. A wonderful place to spend time after a long day of shopping or site seeing. Food was ok being from the cajun country of Louisiana I rather more seasoning. The staff in the executive lounge are friendly, helpful and really want you to enjoy your stay. We were there the middle of September and the weather was great to enjoy all the areas surrounding the hotel. You will love it.
reviews.title: Great Location!

likes.disliked: — would have liked to have a view of harbor

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was great. We didn't have views of the harbor, not sure if any of the rooms have the view. We were on the 12 floor. It was a two blocks away from Circular Quay. It is a great location to catch the buses, metrolink to Darling Harbor, and the trains. We caught the train to Blue Mountains. You can easily walk to The Rocks. There are some great restaurants within walking distance. The room was clean and the bed was SUPER comfy. We got there earlier than our checkin time, but the front desk was really nice and immediately showed us to our room. There are a lot of choices for hotels in sydney. Although I was content with the Marriott, I may try smething else the next time around.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location and is luxurious. It is better than we expected, even though we expected a lot. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Location and view

reviews.text: This is a top rate Marriott property with views over Sydney Harbour and the Opera House--a million dollar view if there was ever one! Great location as it takes only a couple of minutes to walk to Circular Quay (hub for city buses and the train station, as well as range of shops and restaurants) and only slightly longer to the Rocks and to the Botanical Gardens. Terrific concierge desk that gave us great recommendations for neighborhoods to visit, where to shop, and also set up surfing lessons at Bondi for my teenagers--and in each case made it clear what bus to take and approximate cost. (Bus drivers in Sydney were helpful and friendly and made it easy to get around the city.)
reviews.title: great location
My favorite hotel in Sydney
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott for the second year running and the location is great.Just had the one night this year and left on Australia Day.Only a couple of hundred meters from the rocks and still an easy walk into the main shopping areas in Sydney.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff are very good especially in the spacious bar area on the ground floor with a special mention for Robert.
reviews.title: Overpriced but in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are comfortable and the hotel has a relaxed feeling.
reviews.title: A little luxury to end our round Australia trip

likes.liked: — Everything - the location, the views from the room, the splendour of the hotel
likes.disliked: — Lift congestion due to the hotel being very busy due to World Youth Day

reviews.text: We hope to spend a couple of days in Sydney this year and will stay at the Marriott.
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable, good meeting facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all the location is just fantastic and in all honesty that's what you're paying for because at £140 a night (without breakfast!!) the overall quality of the rooms doesn't justify it.
reviews.title: Great Location, spectacular views

reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel. I can't say one bad thing about it. The room was spacious and luxurious. The amenities were great. The location can not be beat. It is very close to the harbor and the Sydney Opera House and the spectacular bonatical gardens. It is also very close to the subway. We stayed for 4 nights and felt very welcome and safe. It was a great way to see Sydney for the first time. It was a bit of a splurge for us, but I figured, how many times am I going to be in Sydney?? At the end of our trip to Australia we came back to Sydney and stayed in a less expensive place on the other side of town. My opinion - Splurge!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic for a Splurge

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our Pacific trip. It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at on this trip. Even some 3-star hotels in other countries were better than this one.
reviews.title: Good Location; average service; overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, which is the only positive about the hotel. Service quality was average and the room although clean was not adequate for its star-rating. They charge about 5 Dollars for 15 minutes usage of the Internet terminals - we could use Internet terminals for free in Honk Kong and Japan.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Don't stay at this hotel unless you want to pay for its name!
reviews.title: A Great Hotel to stay in upon returning to Sydney!

reviews.text: We ordered this hotel on a website where you name your own price and paid about half the price. The hotel is in a great location, only a couple minutes walk from the Opera House. Upon checking in, we were upgraded to an opera house view on the executive level, so we had access to the executive lounge, which was great because breakfast was included. The pool was undergoing constructiong - but we heard no noise and the hotel had arranged for the guests who wanted a pool to go across the street to the four seasons.
reviews.title: Great location. Top quality Marriott.

likes.liked: — Location and ever so smart modern 2 room suite.

reviews.title: First rate hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Sydney Harbour in May 2006. Our 18th floor room at a fabulous view of the Sydney Opera House, and the hotel is located only steps away from the marina. The room was very clean, and the hotel staff very happy to assist us. We would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

We have stayed in many hotels and this hotel was by far one of our favorites of all time. The views were stunning, the service was perfect, the rooms were clean and we thought this hotel was wonderful. We are coming back to Sydney this summer and we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. We give it an A+ and we are hard to please.
reviews.title: A+ to the Marriott Sydney Harbour

reviews.text: This is the second time my husband and I have visited Sydney and found this hotel to be very comfortable each time. We had already paid for an Opera House view room as we did last year as we found it to be a slightly larger room with a great view of the Opera House and circular quay where we watched the ferries go back and forth.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Hotel in Perfect Location
Habour Marriott ideal hotel for first timers
reviews.text: Hotel staff extremely efficient, rooms very comfortable and great restaurant to have breakfast in the morning.

I have read the negative reviews on this hotel and I think they are very unfair, we are particularly fussy where we stay, the state of the room, restaurant etc. and this hotel is very good indeed. Indeed some 5 star hotels cannot match the Sydney Harbour Marriott.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a superb location

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Sydney Harbour Marriott with my husband and two small children. We chose the hotel for it's location and star rating and were not disappointed. From past reviews I have to say there were absolutely NO PROBLEMS with the lifts, they came within a couple of seconds each time. We also payed extra for an Opera House view. It was nice, but there are still a lot of other tall buildings semi-obstructing the view, so agree with a past reviewer and not sure if that was worth it. Our package rate also included a full buffet breakfast for two adults (although we did not have to pay for the kids) and valet parking which was excellent. The breakfast was wonderful and plentiful with the usual expectations from a 5 star hotel; hot and cold selections, pastries, cereals, juices, bacon & eggs with various sides as well as eggs and pancakes made fresh on demand. We also had the Saturday night buffet dinner which was not cheap @ $80.00 per adult, but we made good use of it as there was seafood included which we very much enjoyed. What stood out for us was the staff service and attention. They were very friendly and down to earth, not at all snooty as you expect from some 5 star hotels. Everyone we came across was excellent, especially the restaurant where we were given extra special attention and service due to the kids. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone, especially those travelling with familes.
reviews.title: Marriott Sydney Harbour meets all expectations

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August. We had no problems with the elevators at all - even though work was supposedly going on. We had paid extra for an opera house view - the weather wasn't great, so on balance I didn't think this worth the extra money. The rooms are great, and the breakfast was very nice! The hotel bar was fine - although it closed at 11pm which was a little strange (although it is in the lobby, so you can still sit there). The best thing about the hotel is it's location - you can walk to the opera house, the Rocks and lots of restaurants in about 5 minutes. Also the ferries, trains and buses are only 2 minutes away as well.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — swimming pool is a bit cold!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in early August 2007. Since my husband has platinum status with Marriott we had a fabulous room on the highest floor and access to the concierge lounge, where we had free evening snacks and drinks and breakfast.
reviews.title: Marriott Sydney Harbour at Circular Quay

reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel at 8am on a Saturday and they were able to get us a room right away.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Better Rooms and Poor Elevators

likes.liked: — Location, Rooms were comfortable, massages were reasonably priced
likes.disliked: — Elevators were painfully slow, food quality was poor

reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and modern, as was the bathroom, which had a separate tub and shower.
reviews.title: Wow what a hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel on 21 June 2008. I was a bit disappointed because I originally booked (through the Marriott website) a non-smoking king bed room. We checked in very early on 21 June and our room was not ready, so we came back late in the peace.
reviews.title: mixed feelings about hotel

likes.disliked: — getting a smoking room, when specifically asked for non-smoking room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we came back to the hotel, we were given a double bed smoking room. I was extremely disappointed with this, as I specifically asked that my preference would be a non-smoking room double bed, but I got smoking.
reviews.title: this is the best!

reviews.text: I had previously stayed at the Marriott in Victoria, Canada in 2007 and was very impressed with the facilities and location. Unfortunately, with these expectations in mind, I was expecting that the Sydney Harbourside Marriott would be the same - unfortunately, it wasn't as good. I do have to say that the Marriott in Victoria was recently renovated in the last year, but the Harbourside Marriott has not been and I saw this in the room.
reviews.title: Solid Choice

reviews.text: For those who were thinking of staying in a opera house room (I stayed in one of these rooms on the 19th floor), it is not quite what you think. You can see the opera house, but the view is seen through in between 2 buildings to the left and right of the window - you don't have a 180 degree view which looks directly onto the opera house (if that makes any sense). Also, your room faces east, so when you go and open the blinds in the morning, the sun comes directly into your room/face and blinds you. I do not recall seeing in the room a USB port (which I saw at the Victoria Marriott) which would have been handy to charge an ipod (for example).
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reason why I'm posting this post is because of something that happened on the evening of 21 June, which I was a bit concerned about. I went down to the health club on Saturday evening around 7pm. Firstly, the spa was empty and did not have any water in it (was covered up). So if you have expectations of having a spa in the winter at this Marriott, forget it!
reviews.title: Excellent convenient location!! Average service...

likes.disliked: — Bathroom looks a bit old and cleanliness slightly below average!! Didn't receive any special honeymoon treatment :P

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, terriffic service and wonderful view (from select rooms). We spent our 10th wedding anniversay trip (adult only trip is ex the 3 kids) at the Marriott and it was excellent.The hotel is a half block from Circular Quay which is the harbor area around the Opera house, Harbor bridge, dozens of excellent restaurants and shopping in the Rocks.
reviews.title: Great Location, Pay the Extra for the Opera House View

likes.liked: — Great location to all the icons of Sydney
likes.disliked: — Great views are only from select room due to office buidling in front of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants Near by:
reviews.title: Great Service, Good View from room

likes.disliked: — Probably typically for Australia but didn't like the Internet use fee in business center.

reviews.text: - Cafe Sydeny on the fifth floor of the customs house was our favorite. Need to reserve a terrace table overlooking the opera house and bridge, best inthe harbor.
reviews.title: Ok business hotel - not bad, but you can do better

reviews.text: - Quay on 3nd floor of Overseas Terminal has the best side view of the Opera house of any of the restaurants.
reviews.title: Small Room with a side view of the bridge

likes.liked: — The location within walking distance to the Rocks for restaurants, pubs and bars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Aria at the end of the pier just next to the Opera house was OK but I think over rated and we personally would not return to this one preferring instead to go back to Cafe Sydney or Quay.
reviews.title: Great location. Great views.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this city hotel for 1 night on a flying business trip north.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Service was sensational and professional as one would expect from a 5 star property.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Large, spacious rooms; location, including view of Harbor and Opera House
likes.disliked: — High internet charges (A$19.95 a day)-- should have mentioned in my review!

reviews.text: Conveniently situated neat the financial hub.
reviews.title: No Reward points

reviews.text: A new base for our northern journeys.
reviews.title: Great choice for Opera House view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel in a superb location -- less than five minutes' walk from the ferries at the Circular Quay, and easy walking distance to the Rocks, the Sydney Opera House, and the Royal Botannical Gardens. We arrived rather late in the evening, and the hotel graciously upgraded us when the rooms we originally requested some months earlier were not available. Our rooms were spacious and comfortable, with good views of the Sydney Harbor. The buffet breakfast, which came with our room, offered a wide array of choices, including an egg station, salad items, many types of fruit, and a range of gourmet breads. Although the pool was modest, the hotel's gym was among the best of any I have seen, with a good set of weight-training machines, free weights, and cardiovascular equipment. Hotel employees were uniformly gracious and welcoming, and the concierge staff were generous with their time, providing many good suggestions for dining and touring.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

aka: Marriott Sydney Harbour At Circular Quay Hotel Sydney
description: Sydney Harbour Marriott at Circular Quay is the perfect hotel for those wanting a truly Sydney experience. Overlooking the sparkling Sydney Harbour and the world famous Sydney Opera House, the downtown Sydney hotel can be found at the doorstep of a shopping Mecca, and just moments away from the historic Rocks district. As Sydney’s premier waterfront hotel, guests are also invited to indulge in a luxurious array of treatments in the day spa, including indoor pool, without leaving the 5-star property. Whether savouring finely crafted cuisine at the renowned Icons brassiere restaurant or retiring to the spacious opulence of your guest room which is complete with picturesque harbour views, the accent throughout is on trusted personalised service.
